inventory.commentary: 24oct06 update to wn2.1 added features. ahouston 24oct06 deactivated Sense 3 - realigned wn senses, (1,4) (2,3) ahouston

sense.name: Physical collision, striking contact of two bodies
sense.commentary: IMPACT[+event][+physical][+collision][+forceful] The striking of one body against another. A physical event.
sense.examples: The impact threw me from the car because I wasn't wearing a seatbelt. The impact of the meteor left a gigantic crater. Five seconds until impact, sir! John lay unconscious on the floor, and Mary's fist stung from the impact. There was the sound of a third impact.

sense.name: An effect or consequence, an alteration
sense.commentary: IMPACT[+state][+alteration][+consequence][+significant] The consequence or effect of something
sense.examples: The book had an important impact on my thinking. The psychological impact of the war deeply affected the soldiers. A child's first moments of life leave an impact that will change his or her life. The product will have more impact if you color it bright red. They tried to prevent the impact of American values on European culture. These policies have had no impact on reducing unemployment.
